François de Boisrobert was active in the 17th century, so his plays likely reflect the political and cultural climate of his time. Given the historical ties and cultural influences, Budapest comes to mind as a significant location in Hungary during that period. It was part of the Habsburg Monarchy, which would have had interactions with France, possibly influencing the play's setting.

So, putting it all together, the play is set in 17th-century Hungary, specifically around Budapest. The timeframe from 1630 to 1680 fits well within Boisrobert's active years and the historical context of the period.
